headline: House Gop Report Condemns Bidens Afghanistan Withdrawal
summary: A new House Republican report has condemned a series of perceived failuresof the Biden administration's Afghanistan withdrawal strategy.The "interim" GOP report, released on theone-year anniversary of the U.S. evacuating Afghanistan,claims the White Housedidn't follow through on key strategiesto evacuate civilians from Kabul until the final hours before the city fell to the Taliban. Data from the investigation highlighted how the State Department has evacuated more than 800 Americans from Afghanistan since Aug. 31,which contradicts Biden's commitmentto evacuate the approximate 100 Americans who wanted to leave by that date.The report also revealed that a "significant" number of U.S.-trained Afghan commandos migrated to Iranwith military equipment after the Taliban took over the country. Other key findings found that Biden withdrew forces from Afghanistan despite warnings from top generals, and linked the "sloppy" backlog at the Hamid Karzai International Airport in Kabul to a staff shortage.Reports across the spectrum noted that the GOP will likely make the Afghanistan investigations a key priorityif they reclaim the majority in Congress afterthe midterm elections this fall.
